        public void computePathsFrom(Vertex root)
        Computes all the paths to the root. TODO: implement caching for every node.
        Parameters:
        root - The nodes from which it computes all the minimum paths

      • getShortestPath

        public java.util.List<Vertex> getShortestPath(Vertex from,
                                     Vertex to)
        The shortest path between two vertexes in the graph.
        Parameters:
        from - Starting point of the path
        to - Ending point of the graph
        Returns:
        List of vertexes in the path (in order)
        See Also:
        computePathsFrom(Vertex root), getShortestPathTo(Vertex target)

      • getShortestPath

        public java.util.List<Vertex> getShortestPath(java.lang.String fromId,
                                     java.lang.String toId)
        The shortest path between two vertexes in the graph. It automatically gets the vertexes from the graph (if they exist)
        Parameters:
        fromId - Starting vertex ID
        toId - Ending vertex ID
        Returns:
        List of vertexes in the path (in order)
        See Also:
        getShortestPath(Vertex from, Vertex to)
